description: Federal authorities have dropped an investigation into Robert F. Kennedy Jr. over claims that he cut off and collected the head of a dead whale decades ago, according to Freedom of Information Act documents obtained by Bloomberg.
title: Robert Kennedy Whale Beheading Probe Dropped by US Authorities

description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer says Britons who get additional income from stock holdings don’t count as ‘working people,’ suggesting he’s willing to raise taxes on investors.
title: Starmer Says Owners of Shares Don’t Count as ‘Working People’

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, legal affairs reporter Emily Birnbaum examines public confidence in the US election. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump and Harris Voters Have Wide Trust Gap on Election

description: United Steelworkers President David McCall is making a final push ahead of November’s US election to stress to members why union leadership opposes a Japanese takeover of United States Steel Corp. as some rank-and-file members openly challenge his stance.
title: Steelworkers Boss Goes on 13-Day Blitz to Win Over Wavering Members

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government is taking its foot off the population pedal that’s been a key economic driver. But despite a significant cut to new arrivals, Canada will still see positive growth, according to the immigration minister.
title: Canada’s Economy Won’t Take A Hit From Immigration Curb, Minister Says

description: Investors should be prepared for US market volatility and lower long-term returns on stocks whether Donald Trump or Kamala Harris wins the Nov. 5 presidential election, money managers said at a Bloomberg event in Los Angeles.
title: GOP Sweep Would Ignite Animal Spirits, $12 Billion Adviser Says

description: A majority of voters lack confidence the US Supreme Court would be politically neutral in resolving potential legal challenges around the 2024 presidential election, a survey from Pew Research Center found.
title: Voters Don’t Think US Supreme Court Can Be Fair About the Election, Poll Shows

description: The Group of Twenty’s finance ministers and central bankers see a “soft landing” for the world economy, but warned of mounting risks.
title: G-20 Sees Soft Landing, Warns of Uncertainty, Divergence

description: A country that once embraced mass immigration to give it an edge in the global race to replace aging workers is now pulling the welcome mat away from newcomers. After record population gains strained housing, the job market and public services, Canada unveiled a plan Oct. 24 to drastically reduce admissions. Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government wants to shrink the population of international students and foreign workers in Canada and decreased the annual target for permanent residents — an
title: Why Canada Is Scaling Back its Immigration Ambitions

description: General Motors Co. said governments in Canada are pulling back on subsidies for electric cars at an awkward time — just as they want carmakers to ramp up sales of cleaner vehicles.
title: GM Sees EV Squeeze as Canada Swaps Subsidies for Deadlines

description: President Vladimir Putin said military relations with North Korea are “our business” as he avoided answering whether Pyongyang had sent troops to Russia.
title: Putin Says Russia-North Korea Army Ties Are ‘Our Business’

description: India has appointed Sanjiv Khanna as its next chief justice once the incumbent head of the judiciary, D. Y. Chandrachud, retires next month.
title: India Names Sanjiv Khanna Chief Justice to Replace Chandrachud

description: Israel’s central bank chief said he expects the country’s multi-front conflict to continue until early next year, but start to ease in intensity within about a month.
title: Israel’s Wars to Last Until First Quarter, Says Monetary Chief

description: Vice President Kamala Harris is launching a new ad across all seven battleground states that pledges to crack down on what she calls corporate price gouging and touts her proposed tax cut, as the Democratic presidential nominee looks to continue narrowing Republican Donald Trump’s polling advantage on economic issues.
title: Harris Plans New Ad on Economy to Further Narrow Gap With Trump

description: With a population of just 2.6 million and one of the smallest economies in Europe, Moldova barely registers by most European Union metrics. Yet the small former Soviet republic wedged between EU member Romania and war-ravaged Ukraine has drawn outsized attention from the continent’s powerful democracies and Vladimir Putin’s Russia. After decades under the Kremlin’s influence, Moldova started a concerted shift toward the EU in 2020. That has touched a nerve with pro-Russian forces looking to pull
title: Why Moldova Wants to Move Away From Russia and Join EU Instead

description: A prominent lawmaker behind a bill that spooked Colombian markets this week said congress is discussing ways to limit its fiscal cost.
title: Colombia Lawmakers Seek to Cut Cost of Bill That Spooked Markets

description: Donald Trump vowed to fire Special Counsel Jack Smith if he returns to the White House as he looked to mobilize his base ahead of a western swing-state blitz, with early voting already underway in several battlegrounds.
title: Trump Vows to Fire Special Counsel; Beyoncé to Rally With Harris

description: The US presidential election will likely be decided by a only few thousand voters in a handful of what have come to be known as swing states.
title: A Brief History of Swing States in Presidential Races

description: Pop superstar Beyoncé Knowles-Carter will campaign with Vice President Kamala Harris on Friday, offering the support of an artist who has branded herself as a symbol of empowerment to a candidate seeking to be the first Black woman to win the presidency.
title: Beyoncé to Rally With Kamala Harris, Boosting Her Celebrity Support

description: Portugal has increased police presence in Lisbon’s suburbs after buses were set on fire and other incidents were recorded in the region this week.
title: Portugal Increases Police Presence in Lisbon After Buses Burnt

description: Kenyan President William Ruto backed a decision by his government to accept private capital from Adani Group, which sparked protests and irked the public because of the opacity of some of the deals.
title: Kenya’s Ruto Defends Adani Investment That Stoked Nation’s Anger

description: Negotiators between Israel and Hamas will meet in the coming days, as they make a renewed effort to end the devastating conflict in Gaza, according to the US and Israel.
title: US, Israel Say Gaza Cease-Fire Negotiators to Meet Next Week

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is pulling Canada’s welcome mat away from newcomers as record inflows sank public support for immigration.
title: Trudeau Reverses Course on Immigration After Support Plunges

description: Mozambique’s ruling-party candidate was declared the winner of presidential elections by a landslide as tensions over fraud claims put the southeast African nation on edge.
title: Mozambique’s Ruling Party Wins Vote Tainted by Fraud Allegations

description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves confirmed that she would make tweaks to her fiscal rules to allow more borrowing for investment, as the new Labour administration seeks to boost economic growth.
title: Reeves Says UK Fiscal Rule Change Will Increase Investment

description: A trader who spent more than $45 million on Polymarket bets that Donald Trump will win the upcoming US presidential election has been identified as a French national, following an investigation by the cryptocurrency-based prediction markets platform.
title: Election-Betting Site Polymarket Says Trump Whale Identified as French Trader

description: The German federal government expects €12.6 billion ($13.6 billion) less in tax revenue in the five years through 2028 than estimated in May as Europe’s biggest economy struggles to grow.
title: Germany Sees €12.6 Billion Less in Tax Income by 2028 on Slump

description: Russia has set out proposals for a unified depository and clearance system for BRICS countries, as it seeks to persuade member nations to deepen financial cooperation without the involvement of the West.
title: Russia Pushes for BRICS Clearing, Depository System to Sidestep the West

description: A North Korean balloon carrying trash exploded over the South Korean presidential office in Seoul on Thursday, dumping filth over one of the capital city’s most heavily guarded premises.
title: North Korea’s Balloon Carrying Trash Pops Over South Korean Presidential Office

description: A potential Donald Trump victory and economic troubles at home have prompted China to embark on a charm offensive, particularly with US allies and partners.
title: China Plays Nice With US Partners Ahead of Possible Trump Return

description: Hi, it’s Julia in San Francisco. I visited Aurora, Colorado, to understand how migrants are trying to find a foothold in a community that has become a target of Donald Trump and Elon Musk’s harsh immigration rhetoric. But first...
title: Misinformation From Trump and Musk Makes Aurora Unsafe for Migrants

description: The number of companies in Colombia filing for insolvency this year is on track to reach its highest level in a decade, heaping pressure on President Gustavo Petro to pull the country out of its economic doldrums.
title: Home-Building Woes Spur Colombia Insolvencies Toward Decade High

description: The party of Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban slipped behind that of his upstart challenger Peter Magyar in a second opinion poll in as many days, pointing to a potentially close parliamentary election in 2026.
title: Orban’s Party Loses Lead in Second Opinion Poll in Hungary

description: Finland unveiled the most optimistic population projection in 17 years that sees immigration offsetting a slump in the number of babies born in the Nordic country.
title: Finland Sees Immigrants Upholding Population Growth Through 2070

description: The Biden administration plans to accelerate adoption of artificial intelligence for military and intelligence uses, directing agencies to obtain the most powerful systems in a safe and secure manner, according to plans outlined in a new national security memorandum.
title: White House Pushes Agencies to Adopt AI for Military, Spy Uses

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: US Election Reality Show Grips a Wary World

description: Thousands of solvent UK business owners are winding up their companies, allowing them to avoid an expected increase in levies on entrepreneurs in the budget.
title: UK Budget Fears Push Owners to Close Firms to Avoid Tax Hikes

description: Jailed former Malaysian premier Najib Razak apologized for the 1MDB scandal but denied that he siphoned money from the troubled fund.
title: Malaysia’s Najib Apologizes for 1MDB, Says He Didn’t Take Money

description: Mozambique is due to announce the final results of its Oct. 9 elections on Thursday amid calls from an opposition leader for a national strike and demonstrations over rigging claims.
title: Mozambique to Announce Voting Results Amid National Protest Call

description: The European Union is debating whether to hike tariffs on more Russian agricultural and food products, as well as fertilizers, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Assessing Tariff Hikes on More Russian Agricultural Goods

description: Turkey is carrying out cross-border airstrikes against Kurdish militant groups it accused of a deadly bombing and gun attack on its capital.
title: Turkey Strikes Kurdish Militia After Deadly Attack on Ankara

description: Sri Lanka beefed up security in tourism hot spots after the US and Israel warned citizens to leave popular beach resort areas because of possible attacks on visitors.
title: Sri Lanka Boosts Security as US, Israel Warn of Terrorist Attack

description: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi said BRICS shouldn’t project itself as an alternative to global organizations, even as founding members like Russia and China try to expand the group to challenge the US-led global order.
title: Modi Says BRICS Must Avoid Being an Anti-West Group as It Grows

description: Singapore temporarily blocked the demolition of the house of its first prime minister, Lee Kuan Yew, as it weighs whether to preserve the property that has sparked a yearslong feud among his children.
title: Singapore Blocks Demolition of Ex-Premier Lee Kuan Yew’s Home

description: Somalia’s government asked the African Union and United Nations to exclude Ethiopian soldiers from a revamped peacekeeping force fighting al-Qaeda-linked insurgents.
title: Somalia Wants Ethiopia Excluded From Force Battling Al-Shabaab

description: The famed university town is seen across the political spectrum as a model for how to revive the moribund UK economy. But not everyone is sharing in its success.
title: Booming Cambridge Exposes England’s Widening Wealth Gap

description: Private wealth assets under management in Hong Kong may nearly double to $2.3 trillion in six years, according to Bloomberg Intelligence, with the Asian financial hub projected to surpass Switzerland as the world’s top cross-border wealth center.
title: HK Private Wealth Assets Seen Surging to $2.3 Trillion By 2030

description: Vietnam’s Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh wants to “quicken” progress on three proposed cross-border railway lines linking Vietnam and China, according to a posting on the Vietnam government’s website.
title: Vietnam Premier Aims to ‘Quicken’ Railway Projects With China

description: Japan’s Finance Minister Katsunobu Kato said he is raising the level of urgency for monitoring currency moves, after the yen hit an almost three-month low against the dollar.
title: Japan’s Finance Chief Gives Warning Over Yen’s Rapid Slide

description: Vice President Kamala Harris deepened her closing argument to undecided voters that Donald Trump is unfit to serve a second term, classifying her opponent as a fascist in response to a question during a CNN town hall in key swing-state Pennsylvania.
title: Harris Calls Trump a Fascist in Bid to Sharpen 2024 Contrast

description: Japan’s LDP is at risk of losing its majority in parliament
title: One of the World’s Most Successful Political Parties Is in Trouble in Japan

description: After a 2020 border clash killed at least 20 Indian soldiers, Prime Minister Narendra Modi took a range of steps to block investment from China, even going further than the US in some areas. Now there’s a recognition in New Delhi that he may have gone too far.
title: Xi-Modi Breakthrough Followed Months of Pressure by India CEOs

description: Mariel Garza, the top editorial page editor at the Los Angeles Times, told the Columbia Journalism Review that she quit after the newspaper’s owner blocked a planned endorsement of Kamala Harris for president.
title: LA Times Editorial Chief Quits After Harris Endorsement Quashed
